Package com.badlogic.box2dlights.box2dLight

Class Light

java.lang.Object
com.badlogic.box2dlights.box2dLight.Light
All Implemented Interfaces:
Disposable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ChainLight, DirectionalLight, PositionalLight
public abstract class Light
extends java.lang.Object
implements Disposable
Light is data container for all the light parameters. When created lights are automatically added to rayHandler and could be removed by calling remove() and added manually by calling add(RayHandler).

Implements Disposable

  • Constructor Details

    • Light

      public Light​(RayHandler rayHandler, int rays, Color color, float distance, float directionDegree)
      Creates new active light and automatically adds it to the specified RayHandler instance.
      Parameters:
      rayHandler - not null instance of RayHandler
      rays - number of rays - more rays make light to look more realistic but will decrease performance, can't be less than MIN_RAYS
      color - light color
      distance - light distance (if applicable)
      directionDegree - direction in degrees (if applicable)

  • Method Details

    • setDistance

      public abstract void setDistance​(float dist)
      Sets light distance

      NOTE: MIN value should be capped to 0.1f meter

    • setDirection

      public abstract void setDirection​(float directionDegree)
      Sets light direction

    • attachToBody

      public abstract void attachToBody​(Body body)
      Attaches light to specified body
      Parameters:
      body - that will be automatically followed, note that the body rotation angle is taken into account for the light offset and direction calculations

    • getBody

      public abstract Body getBody()
      Returns:
      attached body or null
      See Also:
      attachToBody(Body)

    • setPosition

      public abstract void setPosition​(float x, float y)
      Sets light starting position
      See Also:
      setPosition(Vector2)

    • setPosition

      public abstract void setPosition​(Vector2 position)
      Sets light starting position
      See Also:
      setPosition(float, float)

    • getX

      public abstract float getX()
      Returns:
      horizontal starting position of light in world coordinates

    • getY

      public abstract float getY()
      Returns:
      vertical starting position of light in world coordinates

    • getPosition

      public Vector2 getPosition()
      Returns:
      starting position of light in world coordinates

      NOTE: changing this vector does nothing

    • setColor

      public void setColor​(Color newColor)
      Sets light color

      NOTE: you can also use colorless light with shadows, e.g. (0,0,0,1)

      Parameters:
      newColor - RGB set the color and Alpha set intensity
      See Also:
      setColor(float, float, float, float)

    • setColor

      public void setColor​(float r, float g, float b, float a)
      Sets light color

      NOTE: you can also use colorless light with shadows, e.g. (0,0,0,1)

      Parameters:
      r - lights color red component
      g - lights color green component
      b - lights color blue component
      a - lights shadow intensity
      See Also:
      setColor(Color)

      public void add​(RayHandler rayHandler)
      Adds light to specified RayHandler

      public void remove()
      Removes light from specified RayHandler and disposes it

      Removes light from specified RayHandler and disposes it if requested

    • dispose

      public void dispose()
      Disposes all light resources
      Specified by:
      dispose in interface Disposable

    • isActive

      public boolean isActive()
      Returns:
      if this light is active

    • setActive

      public void setActive​(boolean active)
      Enables/disables this light update and rendering

    • isXray

      public boolean isXray()
      Returns:
      if this light beams go through obstacles

    • setXray

      public void setXray​(boolean xray)
      Enables/disables x-ray beams for this light

      Enabling this will allow beams go through obstacles that reduce CPU burden of light about 70%.

      Use the combination of x-ray and non x-ray lights wisely

    • isStaticLight

      public boolean isStaticLight()
      Returns:
      if this light is static

      Static light do not get any automatic updates but setting any parameters will update it. Static lights are useful for lights that you want to collide with static geometry but ignore all the dynamic objects.

    • setStaticLight

      public void setStaticLight​(boolean staticLight)
      Enables/disables this light static behavior

      Static light do not get any automatic updates but setting any parameters will update it. Static lights are useful for lights that you want to collide with static geometry but ignore all the dynamic objects

      Reduce CPU burden of light about 90%

    • isSoft

      public boolean isSoft()
      Returns:
      if tips of this light beams are soft

    • setSoft

      public void setSoft​(boolean soft)
      Enables/disables softness on tips of this light beams

    • getSoftShadowLength

      public float getSoftShadowLength()
      Returns:
      softness value for beams tips

      Default: 2.5f

    • setSoftnessLength

      public void setSoftnessLength​(float softShadowLength)
      Sets softness value for beams tips

      Default: 2.5f

    • getColor

      public Color getColor()
      Returns:
      current color of this light

    • getDistance

      public float getDistance()
      Returns:
      rays distance of this light (without gamma correction)

    • contains

      public boolean contains​(float x, float y)
      Checks if given point is inside of this light area
      Parameters:
      x - - horizontal position of point in world coordinates
      y - - vertical position of point in world coordinates

    • setIgnoreAttachedBody

      public void setIgnoreAttachedBody​(boolean flag)
      Sets if the attached body fixtures should be ignored during raycasting
      Parameters:
      flag - - if true all the fixtures of attached body will be ignored and will not create any shadows for this light. By default is set to false.

    • getIgnoreAttachedBody

      public boolean getIgnoreAttachedBody()
      Returns:
      if the attached body fixtures will be ignored during raycasting

    • getRayNum

      public int getRayNum()
      Returns:
      number of rays set for this light

    • setContactFilter

      public void setContactFilter​(Filter filter)
      Sets given contact filter for this light

    • setContactFilter

      public void setContactFilter​(short categoryBits, short groupIndex, short maskBits)
      Creates new contact filter for this light with given parameters
      Parameters:
      categoryBits - - see Filter.categoryBits
      groupIndex - - see Filter.groupIndex
      maskBits - - see Filter.maskBits

    • setGlobalContactFilter

      public static void setGlobalContactFilter​(Filter filter)
      Sets given contact filter for ALL LIGHTS

    • setGlobalContactFilter

      public static void setGlobalContactFilter​(short categoryBits, short groupIndex, short maskBits)
      Creates new contact filter for ALL LIGHTS with give parameters
      Parameters:
      categoryBits - - see Filter.categoryBits
      groupIndex - - see Filter.groupIndex
      maskBits - - see Filter.maskBits
